intro: Pastinaca sativa var. dissecta, commonly known as the curly top celery. This variant is characterized by its finely cut, feathery leaves that give it a distinctive, ornamental appearance. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other plants like parsley and dill. While it is not typically used for culinary purposes, it is often grown as a decorative plant in gardens. Its delicate foliage makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and as a companion plant in mixed borders.
